list_definition.definition: (of people) to shake or tremble, especially with fear

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Her voice was quaking with fear.
The ground quaked under their feet.

list_ex_of_english: The quake's epicenter was located only a few hundred kilometres north of the island group.
By studying evidence of past quakes and closely monitoring ground motion and current earthquake activity, scientists attempt to understand their causes and recurrence intervals.
Cattle grazing in quaking aspen communities consume this grass in large quantities.
Though he survived the quakes, the calamity made him financially vulnerable.
Their gentry were quaking, themselves could not stand.
Recent studies indicate that magnitude 7.1 quakes occur on the fault on a 700-year cycle.
Plant communities include sagebrush shrubland, quaking aspen and lodgepole pine forests, willow carr and marsh.
They were the strongest quakes to affect the city since 1906.
